citing_paper_authors: Kaoru, Yamamoto | Taku, Kudo | Akihiko, Konagaya | Yuji, Matsumoto
raw_text: Previous work in bio-entity (including protein) recognition can be categorized into three approaches: (a) exact and approximate string matching (Hanisch et al, 2003), (b) hand crafted rule-based approaches (Fukuda et al, 1998) (Olsson et al, 2002), and (c) machine learning (Col lier et al, 2000), (Kazama et al, 2002)

citing_paper_authors: Kaoru, Yamamoto | Taku, Kudo | Akihiko, Konagaya | Yuji, Matsumoto
raw_text: In addition, we split the GENIA 1.1 subset into the test dataset of 80 abstracts used in Kazama et al (2002) 8 and the training dataset of the remaining 590 abstracts
clean_text: In addition, we split the GENIA 1.1 subset into the test dataset of 80 abstracts used in Kazama et al (2002) and the training dataset of the remaining 590 abstracts.

citing_paper_authors: Kaoru, Yamamoto | Taku, Kudo | Akihiko, Konagaya | Yuji, Matsumoto
raw_text: Results of protein name recognition in Kazama et al (2002) using GENIA 1.1 are 0.492, 0.664 and 0.565 for precision, recall, f-score respectively
clean_text: Results of protein name recognition in Kazama et al (2002) using GENIA 1.1 are 0.492, 0.664 and 0.565 for precision, recall, f-score respectively.

citing_paper_authors: Goran, Nenadić | Simon, Rice | Irena, Spasić | Sophia, Ananiadou | Benjamin, Stapley
raw_text: In the case of term classification, Kazama et al (2002) used a more exhaustive feature set containing lexical information, POS tags, affixes and their combinations in order to recognise and classify terms into a set of general biological classes used within the GENIA project (GENIA, 2003)
clean_text: In the case of term classification, Kazama et al (2002) used a more exhaustive feature set containing lexical information, POS tags, affixes and their combinations in order to recognise and classify terms into a set of general biological classes used within the GENIA project (GENIA, 2003).

raw_text: Experiments with augmented tag sets in the biomedical domain also show performance loss with respect to smallertagsets ;e.g., Kazama et al (2002) report an F score of 56.2% on a tag set of 25 Genia classes, compared to the 75.9% achieved on the simplest binary case
clean_text: Experiments with augmented tag sets in the biomedical domain also show performance loss with respect to smaller tagsets; e.g., Kazama et al (2002) report an F score of 56.2% on a tag set of 25 Genia classes, compared to the 75.9% achieved on the simplest binary case.

raw_text: Kazama et al (2002) reported an F-measure of 56.5% on the GENIA corpus (Version 1.1) using Support Vector Machines
clean_text: Kazama et al (2002) reported an F-measure of 56.5% on the GENIA corpus (Version 1.1) using Support Vector Machines.

citing_paper_authors: Amgad, Madkour | Kareem, Darwish | Hany, Hassan | Ahmed, Hassan | Ossama, Emam
raw_text: They reported an Fmeasure score of 0.73 for different mixtures of mod els tested on 20 abstracts. (Kazama et al, 2002) proposed a machine learning approach to BNE tagging based on support vector machines (SVM), which was trained on the GE NIA corpus
clean_text: (Kazama et al, 2002) proposed a machine learning approach to BNE tagging based on support vector machines (SVM), which was trained on the GENIA corpus and reported an F-measure score of 0.73 for different mixtures of models tested on 20 abstracts.

raw_text: In the Message Understanding Conference (MUC), Named entity Recognition aims to classify proper nouns, dates, time, measures and locations, etc. Many researchers adapt their systems from MUC to the biomedical domain, such as (Fukuda et al1998), (Proux et al1998), (Nobata et al2000), (Collier et al2000), (Gaizauskas et al2000), (Kazama et al2002), (Takeuchi et al2002), (Lee et al2003) and (Zhou et al2004)

citing_paper_authors: Dan, Shen | Jie, Zhang | Guodong, Zhou | Jian, Su | Chew Lim, Tan
raw_text: In previous research, (Kazama et al 2002) make use of POS information and conclude that it only slightly improves performance
clean_text: In previous research, (Kazama et al 2002) make use of POS information and conclude that it only slightly improves performance.

raw_text: In general, machine learning based methods to relation extraction perform very well for any task where sufficient, representative and high quality training data is available (Kazamaetal., 2002)
